revised_title: Electrophysiological and Morphological Alterations in Motor Nerve in "Motor Endplate Disease" of the Mouse
tldr: The study examines the electrophysiological and morphological changes in the motor nerve of mice affected by hereditary'motor endplate disease'. The research reveals slower conduction velocity, prolonged refractory period, and increased temperature sensitivity in the mutant mice compared to controls. The findings suggest that alterations in the motor axons can account for the failures in neuromuscular transmission observed in the med mutation.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Neuromuscular Biology
